title: Ticket #3114: condor_qedit has non-standard argument parsing
description:
The argument parsing for condor_qedit is non-standard:
  • The order is fixed. It must be first "-d", then "-n", then "-p".
  • The usage should be "-name". I can pass any argument that starts with an "-n" right now.

For the second item - DaemonCore argument parsing has similar issues.
remarks:
2014-Jul-25 16:15:36 by jfrey:
In Condor 8.3, an unsupported command line option, like -help, is treated like an owner name. And supplying at least one, but not enough command-line arguments results in a segmentation fault.
